title.narrative: ACCOUNTABILITY IN TANZANIA PHASE 2 (AcT2) Inclusion of People with Disabilities in Vocational Education, Training and Employment in Tanzania

description.narrative: Project aims to increase the responsiveness and accountability of Government in Tanzania, through a strengthened civil society

activity-date.narrative: The project has been terminated due to FCDO budget cuts.

description.narrative: KPMG first transfer of funds to CBMUK

provider-org.narrative: KPMG first transfer of funds to CBMUK

description.narrative: Improved access to vocational education, training and employment for people with disabilities in Tanzania

title.narrative: Impact indicator 1: % increase in enrolment, retention and graduation of persons with disabilities in mainstream and specialised vocational training centres. Impact indicator 2: % increase in the no. of people with disabilities entering both formal and informal employment sectors

description.narrative: Key duty bearers & decision makers reached with advocacy messaging on vocational education, training & employment priorities for people with disabilities in Tanzania.

title.narrative: Output indicator 2.1: Number of media awareness campaigns & policy dialogues conducted on priorities for vocational education, training and employment of people with disabilities in Tanzania. Output indicator 2.2: Number of annual forum events to promote inclusive employment, vocational education and training for people with disabilities in Tanzania.

description.narrative: Outcome 1. Key duty bearers demonstrate increased commitment, action, and accountability in relation to inclusive vocational education, training and employment opportunities for people with disabilities in Tanzania.

title.narrative: Outcome indicator 1.1: Number of verbal and written commitments/ directives made by Government of Tanzania on promoting and implementing inclusive vocational education and training for people with disabilities, using AcT2 disability research findings. Outcome indicator 1.2: Number of verbal and written commitments/ directives made by Government of Tanzania on promoting and implementing inclusive employment for people with disabilities, using AcT2 disability research findings. Outcome indicator 1.3:Number of VETA members taking appropriate steps to monitor and integrate inclusive practice and reasonable accommodation in vocational education and training. Outcome indicator 1.4: Number of ATE members taking appropriate steps to monitor and integrate inclusive employment practice and reasonable accommodation in the workplace in line with meeting the disability act provisions, NO9. 2010

description.narrative: Research findings report publicised and widely disseminated to key stakeholders.

Output indicator 1.1: Number of key duty-bearers, people with disabilities and DPOs in receipt of the report on access to vocational education, training and inclusive employment for people with disabilities in Tanzania. Output indicator 1.2: Number of policy briefs and factsheets developed on vocational education, training and inclusive employment disseminated to key stakeholders and SHIVYAWATA members in accessible formats.

comment.narrative: DISSEMINATION TARGET: Government level: Key Government Officials/Ministers/Permanent Secretaries: 15 National Launch: 300 stakeholders Regional Launch: 450 stakeholders. x policy briefs 2 x factsheets

description.narrative: Strengthened DPO monitoring in target regions to track GOT policy commitments, and promote inclusive employment & vocational education practices for people with disabilities.

title.narrative: Output indicator 3.1: Number of DPO members with capacity to monitor change in GOT and private sector taking forward research recommendations on inclusive vocational education and employment. Output indicator 3.2: Number of accessibility audits undertaken with vocational education centres, private and public employers, including GOT ministries in the areas targeted. Output indicator 3.3: Number of ATE members committing to implement some of the key recommendations of accessibility audits and integrating inclusive employment practice and reasonable accommodation in the workplace. Output 3.4: Number of VETA members committing to implement some of the key recommendations of accessibility audits and integrating inclusive practice and reasonable accommodation in vocational education.
